meanings.definition: Prexies: Plural of prexy, meaning a president or leader.
meanings.sent1: The prexies of different countries gathered for a summit.
meanings.sent2: The prexies of the company held a meeting to discuss the budget.
meanings.sent3: The prexies decided to have a pizza party to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: She led her team with the authority of a prexy.
meanings.sent5: The prexies of the organization were known for their strong leadership skills.

meanings.definition: Prexies: Informal term for postage stamps featuring presidents.
meanings.sent1: My stamp collection includes rare prexies from the 1930s.
meanings.sent2: The post office released a new set of prexies honoring historical figures.
meanings.sent3: He used prexies to mail his letters to friends around the world.
meanings.sent4: The prexies on the envelopes added a touch of history to his collection.
meanings.sent5: Collectors eagerly sought after the limited edition prexies.

meanings.definition: Prexies: Slang term for high-ranking military officers.
meanings.sent1: The prexies strategized the next move in the military operation.
meanings.sent2: The prexies inspected the troops before the mission.
meanings.sent3: The prexies joked about their strict uniforms during downtime.
meanings.sent4: He admired the courage of the prexies leading the battalion.
meanings.sent5: The prexies' presence on the battlefield inspired the soldiers.
